newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: MANILA'S PHIBOR RATES FALL ON RATE CUT.
newsitem.headline: MANILA'S PHIBOR RATES FALL ON RATE CUT.

text.p: The Philippine interbank offered rates (PHIBOR) started moving down again after the central bank's four percentage-point drop in overnight rates, traders said.
But banks refrained from participating in the market because of the volatile movements in the peso, they said.
"The market adjusted prices down in line with the overnight rate. The yield curve shape is flattening out. Over time, we'll see a normalisation of the yield curve," a trader said.
Interest rates had been showing an inverted yield curve, with short-term rates higher than the longer maturities because of speculation on the peso.
Average rates quoted by 20 banks were:
